page.title: 03Buildings - Age and Usage
page.content: We have been collecting information about the age of buildings in Charing and what they are used for. We have found out that the biggest proportion of the buildings are used for housing and are in the range of ten to fifty years old. The shops in Charing High Street are generally over a hundred years old. We only found three disused buildings and they were all over a hundred years old. Although the buildings are disused now, we expect them to be in use soon as they are for sale. Despite council house development in the last 50 years the overall impression of Charing is that of a largely unspoilt Kentish village.
